noun.description: A tapering orange-colored root eaten as a vegetable.
The cultivated feathery-leaved plant of the parsley family that yields this vegetable.
An offer of something enticing as a means of persuasion (often contrasted with the threat of something punitive or unwelcome)
examples: carrots will promote cooperation over the environment far more effectively than sticks

origin: Late 15th century: from French carotte, from Latin carota, from Greek karōton.
